customize.text: each day. It can be used to obtain a
and one of the following Normal/Delicious/Suspicious Dishes:

customize.name: Barbeque Ribs
customize.desc: A crispy meat dish. Lightly fry the surface of the ribs until they exude a faint aroma, then wrap the crispy exterior with sauce, and finally, grill them slowly on low heat. The meticulous temperature control ensures that the exterior is perfectly crisp, while the meat within is kept juicy and tender.

customize.name: Coffee Bavarois
customize.desc: A refreshing dessert. Though it is one of Fontaine's trademark desserts, its recipe is very simple and straightforward. As long as the proportion of ingredients is right, hardly anyone could fail at making this dessert. It has an exquisite texture with a touch of refreshing cold taste, and can instantly lift your spirits.

customize.name: Fish and Chips
customize.desc: A deep-fried appetizer. Coat fish fillets with batter and deep-fry until golden and crispy, then add a few chips on the side. This combination is so miraculous that whatever sauce you choose, it will always bring a hearty smile to your face.

customize.name: Fontainian Onion Soup
customize.desc: An onion soup. Stir-fry the onion until it is slightly charred, and boil it in broth. Transfer the contents to a soup bowl, add a slice of bread, sprinkle some cheese, and bake it in the oven. Well-seasoned chefs never cry when chopping onions, and here's their secret trick: Let the apprentices do the job.

customize.name: Garlic Baguette
customize.desc: Sliced baguette. Taken freshly out of the oven, the bread has a crispy, crackling crust, and soft, fluffy crumb. The aroma of butter and garlic further adds to the baguette's tastiness! No wonder you often see Fontainians buying a baguette on their way home after work.

customize.name: Haggis
customize.desc: A dish with strong and distinctive flavors. Chop up the sheep offal, mix it with oatmeal, and stuff the mixture into a sheep stomach along with various seasonings and spices. When the dish is served, the stomach-bag is usually removed while the fillings are served with radish paste and mashed potatoes. This is a local specialty that Fontainians often cook as a treat for important guests.

customize.name: Lasagna
customize.desc: A baked pasta dish. Spread cheese, meat sauce, and BÃ©chamel sauce on a layer of pasta strips, and place another layer of pasta strips on the top - repeat the process a few times and bake the pasta until the cheese becomes golden and bubbly. The secret of its tastiness lies in the carefully-prepared meat sauce.

customize.name: Mint Jelly
customize.desc: A refreshing dessert. The steps to making this are quite simple indeed, and when it slides down your throat, the faint, fresh flavor of mint will leave you feeling reinvigorated for the rest of the day.

customize.name: Mint Salad
customize.desc: A fragrant salad dish. Finely chopped Jueyun Chilis blended with a sauce and mixed with Mint leaves. It looks like nothing special, but it has surprisingly potent powers of refreshment and reinvigoration. It is also the perfect palate-cleanser after a greasy, indulgent meal.

customize.name: Minty Bean Soup
customize.desc: A rich soup made with simple ingredients. Mints and beans were boiled and ground together to get a smooth texture. The soup was then left on low heat till it thickened. Finally, some beans and mints were sprinkled on the top. This refreshing delicacy tastes equally good whether served hot or cold.

customize.name: Poisson Seafood Soup
customize.desc: A seafood soup. It originated in the fishing village Poisson. Fishermen used to process leftover fish by stewing them together. This soup then became popular in Fontaine due to its freshness. Nowadays, almost any type of aquatic product can be included in this dish.

customize.name: Pop's Teas
customize.desc: Tea from Liyue. After a grueling trek around the vast region of Liyue, there's nothing more rejuvenating than a big swig of tea from Pop's Teas.

customize.name: Steak
customize.desc: A grilled steak. High heat has locked the juices in, giving one high expectations for when the meat is cut open.

customize.name: Tasses Ragout
customize.desc: A vegetable ragout. It is an improvised dish created by Fontainian farmers celebrating vegetable harvests. There are no strict rules for the amount of ingredients or the cooking method. Be it stir-fried or baked, this unpretentious dish never fails to delight with its rustic savor.

customize.name: Teyvat Fried Egg
customize.desc: An egg fried on one side. The yolk flows out nicely when broken. So satisfying.

customize.name: Trout Amandine
customize.desc: Fish fillets of a satisfying size, fried with butter before serving with a side of crispy fried almonds. According to the traditional recipe for this dish, a whole readied trout would be placed into the frying pan, but a new, fillet-featuring recipe for this dish has been gaining popularity recently as well.

customize.name: Welfare Meal
customize.desc:
A Welfare Meal from the Coupon Cafeteria. As it's free, there's an element of surprise and risk.

Use to obtain a meal and a Fortune Slip.
